timeline.message: Rename text on card so it fits
Adds redirect from original connect-jdbc-avro page

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
              problem: "you have data in a table in a database, are pulling that data via a JDBC source connector (which by default does not add a key to the Kafka message), and you want to create a Kafka Stream using SpecificAvro, letting Kafka Streams to add the key."
          
          
            
              problem: "you have data in a table in a database, are pulling that data via a JDBC source connector (which by default does not add a key to the Kafka message), and you want to create a Kafka Stream using SpecificAvro, letting Kafka Streams add the key."
timeline.author: colinhicks
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -150,10 +150,10 @@ serialization:
     ksql: enabled
     kstreams: enabled
 
-connect-jdbc-specificavro:
-  title: "Ingesting data via a JDBC source connector into Kafka Streams"
-  slug: "/connect-jdbc-specificavro"
-  problem: "you have data in a table in a database, are pulling that data via a JDBC source connector (which by default does not add a key to the Kafka message), and you want to create a Kafka Stream with an added key, using SpecificAvro."
+connect-jdbc-kstreams-rekey-specificavro:
+  title: "Ingesting data via a JDBC source connector into Kafka Streams as SpecificAvro, adding a key in Kafka Streams"
+  slug: "/connect-jdbc-kstreams-rekey-specificavro"
+  problem: "you have data in a table in a database, are pulling that data via a JDBC source connector (which by default does not add a key to the Kafka message), and you want to create a Kafka Stream using SpecificAvro, letting Kafka Streams to add the key."

timeline.bodyText: I suggest leaving out the "adding key" part for now. Can address later if this becomes an important distinction from other Connect tutorials.
timeline.author: colinhicks
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -94,7 +94,7 @@

Apache Kafka is a powerful, scalable, fault-tolerant distri
Connect data sources & sinks.
    -
  • Create a stream from a JDBC source
    • +
  • JDBC to SpecificAvro stream adding key

replies.bodyText: @colinhicks the next tutorial I'd like to write will be similar to this one, but the keying functionality will be via Connect/SMT versus Kafka Streams. If we leave off "adding key", it will be harder to differentiate the tutorials even though they are very different workflows.  WDYT?
replies.author: ybyzek

replies.bodyText:
@ybyzek, that makes sense. The space constraints are tough, here. Kind of like a newspaper.
Do you think it's reasonable to use just enough distinguishing detail to frame the story of each tutorial? For example, maybe the next tutorial you described can have a headline (link text) like:
Key a stream with Kafka Connect SMT or
Key a stream with transformations
replies.author: colinhicks

replies.bodyText:
@colinhicks  We can't just decrease the font like the classifieds in a newspaper? j/k :)
The suggestions above do leave off two details:

SpecificAvro: the next KT was going to be JSON, but the description can explain that.  And it may not be as high priority to mention in the title.
JDBC: that it's a JDBC source connector versus another source connector, but that's also not as high priority, it's a detail actually

But all in all, given the space constraints, I think you found the best solution, thank you!
replies.author: ybyzek

replies.bodyText: Haha, we could always link-farm ourselves with kafka.craigslist.org 😛
replies.author: colinhicks

timeline.message: Rename to Key a stream with transformations
